categories.name: The Art of Baking: Cakes and Pies

questions.clue: This cake is known for its rich, red color and is often paired with cream cheese frosting.
A pie made with a sweet filling of apples, cinnamon, and sugar, often topped with a lattice crust.
This classic French dessert is a sponge cake soaked in coffee and layered with mascarpone cheese.
A pie made with a creamy, tart filling using condensed milk and key lime juice, often topped with whipped cream.
Originating in Austria, this cake features layers of chocolate sponge, apricot jam, and a dark chocolate icing.
This popular nickname for cannabis is also a term used for a type of dessert, like cakes and pies.
This reggae legend was an advocate for cannabis, often referring to it as 'the healing of the nation.'
In this 1936 film, cannabis is depicted as a dangerous drug leading to insanity and crime.
This ancient Chinese emperor is credited with being one of the first to document the medicinal use of cannabis around 2737 BC.
Cannabis was legally banned in the United States with this 1937 act, which marked a pivotal moment in its regulation history.
For 200 points: This piece of hockey gear protects players' knees and shins from pucks and sticks.
For 400 points: This legendary player, known as 'The Great One,' holds the record for most career goals in the NHL.
For 600 points: This term describes a goal scored when a player shoots the puck so fast it sounds like a pie being sliced.
For 800 points: Named after an NHL player, this trophy is awarded annually to the league's top goal scorer.
For 1000 points: In 1988, this player was traded from the Edmonton Oilers to the Los Angeles Kings in a deal that shocked the hockey world.
This Polish-born physicist and chemist was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and the only person to win in two scientific fields.
Known for her work on the structure of DNA, this British scientist's X-ray diffraction images were crucial to discovering the DNA double helix.
This American geneticist, the first woman to win a Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine alone, discovered mobile genetic elements in maize.
A pioneer in radioactivity, this physicist was instrumental in the discovery of the element protactinium and mentored by Marie Curie.
The first African-American woman to travel into space, this engineer and physician flew aboard the Space Shuttle Endeavour in 1992.
This capital city of France is known for its pastries, including croissants and éclairs.
Known for its green initiatives, this capital of the Netherlands might remind you of a different type of green.
This Canadian capital city is home to the Ottawa Senators, an NHL team.
In this city, you can tour the Guinness Storehouse and also enjoy a hearty shepherd's pie.
Known for the annual Cherry Blossom Festival, this U.S. capital city is also famous for its political 'high stakes' atmosphere.

final.clue: This dessert, often enjoyed during Thanksgiving, shares a name with a popular outdoor game played with a curved stick.
